content: in order after the universal pattern universal newborn 0-3 months 3-6 months 6-12 months 1-2 years 3-5 years 6-8 years stitch count remains the same from row 1-14 24 27 27 30 33 36 36 part 1 body chain 25 28 28 31 34 37 37 row 1 beginning in second chain from hook half_double_crochet 24 27 28 30 33 36 36 across in back bump pic 1 row 2-4 chain 1 turn half_double_crochet across pause to measure and confirm gauge you should aim to be within 1/2 of 13 14 25 14 25 15 5 16 75 18 18 row 5-6 chain 1 turn single_crochet 1 half_double_crochet 22 25 25 28 31 34 34 single_crochet 1 row 7-8 chain 1 turn single_crochet 2 half_double_crochet 20 23 23 26 29 32 32 single_crochet 2 row 9 chain 1 turn single_crochet 3 half_double_crochet 18 21 21 24 27 30 30 single_crochet 3 skip to part 2 for newborn size row 10 chain 1 turn single_crochet 3 half_double_crochet 21 21 24 27 30 30 single_crochet 3 skip to part 2 for 0-3 month size row 11 chain 1 turn single_crochet 3 half_double_crochet 21 24 27 30 30 single_crochet 3 skip to part 2 for 3-6 month size row 12 chain 1 turn single_crochet 4 half_double_crochet 22 25 28 28 single_crochet 4 skip to part 2 for size 6-12 month size row 13 chain 1 turn single_crochet 4 half_double_crochet 25 28 28 single_crochet 4 skip to part 2 for size 1-2 yr size and 3-5 yr size row 14 chain 1 turn single_crochet 4 half_double_crochet 28 single_crochet 4 continue on to part 2 for 6-8 year size part 2 edging and ties - chain 1 rotate 90 degrees and work across short edge pic 2 *single_crochet decrease repeat from * across approximately 6-7 7-8 8-9 8-9 9-10 9-10 10-11 stitches this is part of the neckline your last stitch will go into the corner - chain 22 23 23 24 25 26 27 slip_stitch in second chain from hook and back down chain - single_crochet in same corner space that you started the chain from counts as first stitch you ll now be working across the front of the bonnet single_crochet 23 26 26 29 32 35 35 - chain 22 23 23 24 25 26 27 slip_stitch in second chain from hook and back down chain boyd pixie bonnet pattern - yarn republic 4 - single_crochet in same corner space that you started the chain from you ll now be working across the other half of the neckline continue on across the short edge *single_crochet decrease repeat from * across approximately 6-7 7-8 8-9 8-9 9-10 9-10 10-11 stitches the right side is facing you now - fold bonnet in half bringing short edges together make sure the right sides are facing in towards each other pic 3 - join sides together with slip_stitch pic 3 - single_crochet back of bonnet together or cut a long tail and sew it together -
